N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800014020: The Great Caravan, they called itâ€¦ but it's been lost to us for ages.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800014030: I've been searching for it as long as I can remember.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800014040: And with a name like that,
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800014050: You'd hope they kept some fine goods there, eh.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800015000: The howl of a wolf, in the Mistwood...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800015010: I suppose he must still be skulking about...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800015020: Mmm, I know. Why not meet him for yourself?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800015030: Next time you hear the wolf's howl, make this signal right under the source.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800015040: Oh, don't fret, there is nothing to fear.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800015050: I just have an inkling the two of you might hit it off.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800016000: Oh, by the way. There's someone you should meet.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800016010: If you happen to hear a wolf's howl, make this signal under the source.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800017000: Oh, then you met Blaidd, did you?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800017010: Wonderful. I'm glad I pointed you in his direction.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800017020: He's boorish, blunt, and couldn't find his nose with both hands, but he's a good egg.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800017030: I think the two of you are sure to find the best in one another.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800030010: I knew leaving the sign would be worth the trouble.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800030020: Thought I'd set up shop here for a time.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800030030: A pleasure, as ever. Care to purchase anything?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800031020: Thought I'd set up shop here for a time.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800031030: Right then. Care to purchase anything?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800032000: Have you seen a crow around here by any chance?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800032010: You know, a burial crow, with a letter fastened to its claw?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800032020: Well, if you do set eyes upon it, I'll buy that letter from you, no question.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800032030: I'd give you a generous sum for it, of course.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800033000: My thanks. I've been wanting to get my hands on this.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800033010: And I was willing to pay whatever was needed. Your reward, as promised.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800034000: So, about the letter you brought me...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800034010: It's just as I suspected, it features a cryptogram of my people.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800034020: And I'm sure it's come from wherever the Great Caravan disappeared to.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800034030: This could be my chance to get close to it.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800035000: Once I decipher that cryptogram, I'll be packing up shop again.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800035010: Don't worry, I'll leave a sign that shows where I've gone.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800035020: With any luck, I'll see you there, eh.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800036000: I've always preferred my own company, to that of other people's...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800036010: And I don't have any burning questions I wish to ask my ancestors...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800036020: But there's something I need to know.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800036040: I want to know who I am. Where I came from. Where I'm headed.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800050010: I knew leaving the sign would be worth the trouble.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800050020: The shop is all set up.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800050030: A pleasure as ever. Care to purchase anything?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800051000: Oh yes, about the cryptogram from the letter...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800051010: I think it's pointing underneath the capital.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800051020: I think it's pointing here, underneath the capital.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800051030: But I'm perplexed as to the path to take down there.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800051040: Well, the journey can wait, I suppose.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800051050: I'll settle here for the time being, and start looking into it.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800053000: I can't imagine how it ended up there...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800053010: But the well might just lead under the capital.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800053020: To the spot indicated by the cryptogram from the letter.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800053030: Seems like an odd place for the Great Caravan...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800053040: But no amount of thinking will change anything. I'll be heading straight there, after some preparation.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800053050: Once again, I find myself in your debt.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800053060: Take this, as a token of my appreciation.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800053070: It's not from my usual stock, but something rather more special.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800053080: I hope you can join me at the Great Caravan, in fact.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800053090: Who knows what wonders there might be to trade?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800054010: Did you see? What they did to my ancestors?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800054020: The whole clan, buried alive. Sick. Maddened. Husks of themselves.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800054030: Have you heard their moans? They're hardly human anymore.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800054040: They think we worship the Three Fingers? That we called the maddening sickness down upon them?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800054050: Well. If that's what they expect from us, then that's what they shall get from us!
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800054060: The world of grace and its people should have been content to see us sink between the cracks.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800054070: But to have intruded upon our solace... Having broken us upon their whims...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800054080: I'll never forgive any of you.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800055000: I'm sorry, but we won't be trading any longer.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800055010: And...I think it's time we parted ways.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800055020: Guided by grace, you seek to become Elden Lord.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800055030: I don't want anything to do with you Tarnished lot any more.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800056010: It's my fault that we stumbled into this mess.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800057000: I'm sorry, but we won't be trading any longer.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800057010: I think it's time we parted ways.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800058030: You've inherited the flame of frenzy!
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800058040: Oh, that's it... That's what I need...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800058050: To melt away the curses, suffering, and despair. And the Order, entire.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800059000: Oh, that's it... That's what I need...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800059010: To melt away the curses, suffering, and despair. And the Order, entire.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800070000: O Three Fingers, throw wide the door.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800070010: Please, bestow unto me the yellow flame of chaos.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800070020: A frenzied flame to melt away the curses, suffering, and despair. And the Order, entire.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800071010: I was not... a suitable home.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800071030: You, who reached the Three Fingers' abyss...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800071040: Tell the one... Who will become Lord...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800071050: Divest yourself of everything, and head to the door.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800071080: To melt away the curses, suffering, and despair. And the Order, entire.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800072010: I was not... a suitable home.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800072030: Melt away the curses, suffering, and despair. And the Order, entire.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800100000: Are you offering that drink to me?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800100010: Oh, no, what do you take me for? I am an honest merchant of good standing!
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800100030: Oh, for heaven's sake, I jest.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800100040: That's a very kind gesture, and I accept.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800100050: A pleasure as ever, old friend.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800802000: I knew you for a highwayman all along.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800802010: Then it's time you learnt a lesson.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800802020: Our people will not stand for your barbarism!
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800803000: Is that all you were, mate?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800811000: So you're just like the others?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800811010: Another would-be oppressor to my people.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800812000: I see. I see how it is! You were one of them all along!
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800812010: Trying to trample us underfoot, you grace-given bastard?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.800814000: Your kind...will all be razed clean.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801001010: Yes, right this way... Right this way...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801002010: Valued customer... Come trade, in our wandering emporium.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801002030: I'm hungry. I've been hungry so long. Please.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801003010: How nice of you to stop by, again.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801050010: Surprised you found me in my little nook.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801050020: No matter, no matter. Your money's as good as anyone else's.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801050030: Why don't you take a look at my wares?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801050050: Don't ask me how I got my hands on them, eh.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801051010: Not everyone can tell how good my wares are. You've a discerning eye, you have.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801200020: Are you here as a customer?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801202020: I-I didn't realise you came back.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801203010: I'm afraid I've very little to offer.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801204000: Oh, nothing that suits your tastes, then?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801252010: Well, be on your way, then.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801300010: It's been an age since I've seen a customer.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801300020: How can I help, here at the end of the earth?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801302020: Did this aged merchant have something that caught your eye?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801350020: Well, how long has it been.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801352010: Divorce from one's trade does not come easily.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801801000: Bollocks! What the devil's wrong with you!
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801803010: Melt away with the rest of it...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801810010: What are you playing at! Stop this!
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801811000: That's the last straw, you bloody thief!
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801812000: Stay away, Us wanderers have had enough.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801840030: It was me! It's all my fault!
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801842000: I warned you. I told you to stop...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801851000: I knew it, you dirty scoundrel!
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801851010: There was something off about you from the start!
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801852000: Hurry up and die! You wretched thief!
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801863010: Of the swiftness of a wanderer's fury.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801872000: You'd come this far for your pillaging?
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801872010: No different than a plague, your kind.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801873000: I've heard enough from you. Be gone.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.801874000: All that I wanted was solitudeâ€¦
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.900001000: A spirited warcry. Several variations (long and short). â€œRargh!â€ or â€œGraaaahâ€, etc.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.900001100: Grunt of determination when taking a hit. Multiple variations. Grunts such as "Hngh!" or "Ungh" .

N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7000:
I'm bound northways for Liurnia.
May fate find us doing business again.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7020:
There's a traitor taken care of.
Onwards to Nokron, then.
Go on. I'll catch up.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7030:
Find yourself maidenless?
Off to Liurnia with you, then!
Seek the Rose Church, west of the Gate Town.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7040: Surely what you seek is somewhere close by...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7050: Rainbow Stones lead the way to riches...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7070: Stop by the shack beyond the southern gate
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7100:
I'm bound northways for Leyndell.
May fate find us doing business again.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7110: Seek the western edge of the main road
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7120: Seek a shattered bridge at the top of a bypath
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7130:
Though the path be broken and uncertain,
claim your place as Elden Lord!
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7160: A chamber lies under the ruins
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7170: Far to the east, you'll find the Cathedral of Dragon Communion. A place where draconic power gathers.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7180: I'll defile you next. Come to the outer moat.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7190: I thought this a mountain of fire, but I hardly feel a thing! I'll have to head further down...
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7200: I will return to the academy, my apprentice. To expel the Carian royal family, and restore the primeval current.

N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.61010:
Godrick the Golden, humiliated
Having tasted defeat by the Blade of Miquella
Now on his knees, begging for mercy
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.61011:
Lord Godfrey, at last at the end of his campaign
His golden armies unvanquished and unbowed
Yet finds grace lost, tattered and faded
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.61012:
The siege of Castle Morne
A lone hero fights for his vengeance
Only to fall at the hand of Lord Godfrey
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.61020:
This marks Malenia's southward march
The Blade of Miquella and her Cleanrot Knights
Grant her wings never to be clipped
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.61021:
The Second Liurnian War
No victory for the golden, nor for the moon
No prize but atonement; the birth of a vow
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.61022:
The resting place of the contemptible Cuckoos
Lost in the siege of Caria Manor
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.61023:
The First Liurnian War
Radagon's glory burns red as his hair
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.61030:
The Routing of the Ancient Dragons
Godwyn the Golden fought to the last,
Earning the friendship of dread Fortissax
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.61031:
The First Defense of Leyndell
A sovereign alliance rots from within
Traces yet remain of bloody conspiracy
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.61032:
The Second Defense of Leyndell
The Fell Omen stacks high the corpses of heroes
Yet the Erdtree remains unshaken
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.61040:
The Battle of Aeonia
Radahn and Malenia locked in stalemate
Then, the scarlet rot blooms
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.61041:
The Starscourge Conflict
Radahn alone holds Sellia secure
And stands tall, to shatter the stars
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.61050:
The War against the Giants
Champions battle, trolls betray
Fire vanquished, the era of the Erdtree begins

Attribute governing HP.
Also affects fire resistance
and immunity.

Attribute governing stamina.
Also affects robustness.
This attribute also determines how
heavy your equipment can be.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.30402:
Attribute that determines FP.
Also affects focus.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.30403:
Attribute required to wield heavy armaments.
Also boosts attack power of strength-scaling
armaments and affects your physical defense.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.30404:
Attribute required to wield advanced armaments.
Also boosts attack power of dexterity-scaling
armaments, reduces casting time of spells,
softens fall damage, and makes it harder to
be knocked off your horse.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.30406:
Attribute required to perform glintstone
sorceries. Also boosts magic power of
intelligence-scaling sorceries and improves
magic resistance.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.30407:
Attribute required to perform sacred
incantations. Also boosts magic power
of faith-scaling incantations.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.30409:
Attribute governing discovery.
Also affects holy defense, vitality,
and certain sorceries and incantations.

N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121010:
If you set a multiplayer password, you'll only be matched with other players using the same password for most multiplayer features.

However, multiplayer passwords do not apply to invasion or support multiplayer.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121011:
If you set a group password, you'll be more likely to see messages, summon signs, bloodstains, phantoms, and so on from others using the same password.

Elements given this special priority will appear differently from others.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121100:
With a Furlcalling Finger Remedy, you can see summon signs, which can be used to summon players from other worlds.
(Finger Remedies are consumed with use.)

There are various types of summon signs.
Gold signs summon Furled Finger cooperators.
Red signs summon duelist adversaries.
(For either type of multiplayer, the summoning player becomes Host of Fingers.)
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121101:
With a Furlcalling Finger Remedy, you can see summon signs, which can be used to summon players from other worlds.
(Finger Remedies are consumed with use.)

There are various types of summon signs.
Gold signs summon Furled Finger cooperators.
Red signs summon duelist adversaries.
(For either type of multiplayer, the summoning player becomes Host of Fingers.)
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121102:
You can leave a gold summon sign to play cooperative multiplayer.

This sign will appear in other players' worlds and allow them to summon you as a Furled Finger for cooperative multiplayer.
Multiplayer begins once you are summoned.
(Your objective will be to defeat the area boss.)

If you leave a second summon sign, the older sign will vanish.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121103:
You can leave a gold summon sign to play cooperative multiplayer.

This sign will appear in other players' worlds and allow them to summon you as a Furled Finger for cooperative multiplayer.
Multiplayer begins once you are summoned.
(Your objective will be to defeat the area boss.)

If you leave a second summon sign, the older sign will vanish.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121104:
You can leave a red summon sign to play competitive multiplayer.

This sign will appear in other players' worlds and allow them to summon you as a duelist adversary for competitive multiplayer.
Multiplayer begins once you are summoned.
(Your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers.)

If you leave a second summon sign, the older sign will vanish.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121105:
You can leave a red summon sign to play competitive multiplayer.

This sign will appear in other players' worlds and allow them to summon you as a duelist adversary for competitive multiplayer.
Multiplayer begins once you are summoned.
(Your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers.)

If you leave a second summon sign, the older sign will vanish.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121106:
Attempt to invade another player's world as a Bloody Finger.

If you successfully invade, invasion multiplayer will begin. (Your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers.)

You can attempt another invasion of the same world by using a Phantom Finger item. (These items are consumed upon use.)
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121108:
Choose a summoned player to
send back to their own world.

This player will be removed
from the multiplayer session.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121109:
Removed from multiplayer session.
Returning to own world.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121110:
Lures in invaders.

This allows your world to be invaded without any Furled Finger cooperators present, and it also shortens the interval between windows of opportunity for invasion.

Additionally, enables the arrival of a second invader to join when a cooperator is present. (With two invaders, the maximum number of cooperators becomes one.)
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121111: Stop beckoning invaders to your world
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121112:
Puts you into a ready state to answer, should
someone in another world call for rescue.
You will be summoned to their world as a hunter.

Multiplayer will begin once you are summoned.
(Your objective will be to defeat invaders.)
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121114:
Allows you to automatically request for a hunter from another world to come to your rescue when your world is invaded.

You can also use this after being invaded to summon a hunter for help.
(Summoning rescuers may not always be possible.)
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121116:
Send a cooperative summon sign to several nearby summoning pools (activated pools only).

If you are summoned, you will be transported to that summoning pool's location in the host player's world and multiplayer will begin.
(Your objective will be to help the host player defeat the area boss.)
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121117: Remove co-op summon sign from summoning pool
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121118:
Send a competitive summon sign to several nearby summoning pools (activated pools only).

If you are summoned, you will be transported to that summoning pool's location in the host player's world and multiplayer will begin.
(Your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers.)
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121119: Remove hostile summon sign from summoning pool
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121120:
Attempt to invade another player's world as a Bloody Finger.

If you successfully invade, your Festering Bloody Finger will be spent and invasion multiplayer will begin. (Your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers.)

You can attempt another invasion of the same world by using a Phantom Finger item. (These items are consumed upon use.)
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.121122:
Attempt to invade another player's world as a recusant.

If you successfully invade, invasion multiplayer will begin. (Your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers.)

You can attempt another invasion of the same world by using a Phantom Finger item. (These items are consumed upon use.)

N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297130:
A knight exiled from their homeland to
wander. A solid, armor-clad origin.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297131:
A nomad warrior who fights wielding two
blades at once. An origin of exceptional
technique.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297132:
A stalwart hero, at home with a battleaxe,
descended from a badlands chieftain.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297133:
A dangerous bandit who strikes for
weak points. Excels at ranged combat
with bows.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297134:
A scholar who reads fate in the stars.
Heir to the school of glintstone sorcery.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297135:
A seer ostracized for inauspicious
prophecies. Well-versed in healing
incantations.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297136:
A capable fighter from the distant Land of
Reeds. Handy with katana and longbows.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297137:
A prisoner bound in an iron mask. Studied
in glintstone sorcery, having lived among
the elite prior to sentencing.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297138:
A church spy adept at covert operations.
Equally adept with a sword as they are
with their incantations.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297139:
A poor, purposeless sod, naked as the day
they were born. A nice club is all they have.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297150:
No keepsake. The past has been well and
truly left behind.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297151:
A medallion inlaid with crimson amber.
Increases maximum HP.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297152:
The gold of grace shining in the eyes of
the people of the Lands Between.
Use to gain many runes.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297153:
A golden seed washed ashore from the
Lands Between. Said to reinforce
Sacred Flasks.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297154:
The ashes of small, diminutive golems.
Ashes are said to hold spirits within.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297156:
Three strange cracked pots that somehow
mend themselves. A container for certain
thrown items.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297157:
Two stone keys shaped like swords.
Breaks the seal on imp statues, but can only be used once.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297158:
Five sacred branches charged with beguiling
power. Said to originate from the
demigod Miquella.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297159:
Five pieces of boiled prawn.
Boosts physical damage negation.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297160:
The crazed likeness of a noble whose eyes have been gouged out.
Attracts enemies' aggression.

The most common face among the Tarnished.
After all, they were all warriors once.

The face of an austere pilgrim.
There are many roads to truth.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297202:
A regal face found among those who claim
noble blood in the Lands Between.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297203:
Face found among a proud and seclusive
tribe of folk well-versed in ancient
legends and heresies alike.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297204:
A face found among the hardy people
of the unforgiving north. Some say
they're descended from giants.

The face of one who wanders the seas in
search of their home in the Lands Between.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297206:

of Reeds, where blood is a familiar sight.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297207:
The stony face of the people of the
ancient dragons, among whom life
is typically short.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297208:

Nightfolk. Few in number, they were
said to bleed silver long ago.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.297209:

descendants of denizens of another
world. Long-lived but seldom born.

N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600000: These Terms of Service (hereinafter referred to as the "TOS") shall apply to any matters between Players, as defined in the TOS, and FromSoftware, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as the "Company") of the use of online services (hereinafter referred to as the "Services") for the game software, "ELDEN RING" (hereinafter referred to as the "Software") developed by the Company. Players shall use the Services in accordance with the TOS. Should any Player fail to consent to the TOS, such Player may not use the Services. Players shall be deemed to have consented to the TOS when using the Services.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600001:
Article 1. Scope and Modification of TOS
1. The Company may, in addition to the TOS, separately notify Players of terms of use, precautions, guidelines and other terms and conditions (hereinafter referred to as "Individual Terms") where appropriate by posting Individual Terms on the official website operated by the Company (hereinafter referred to as the "Website") or through other means. Individual Terms shall constitute part of the TOS, and if any provision of Individual Terms conflicts with the TOS, the provision of Individual Terms shall apply and supersede the TOS.
2. The Company shall be entitled to modify or revise the TOS and Individual Terms where appropriate from time to time, and in this case, may notify Players of such modification or revision by posting the same on the Website or through other means the Company thinks it reasonable.
3. If any Player fails to consent to the modification or revision of the TOS and Individual Terms, the Company shall be entitled to have the Player cease or suspend his/her use of the Services.
4. Players shall be deemed to have consented to the modified or revised the TOS through their continuous use of the Services after the Players have been notified of such modification or revision through any means set forth in Paragraph 1 of this Article.
5. When Players use the Services, the necessary terms and conditions for the use of STEAMÂ® shall apply.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600002:
Article 2. Definition of Players
The term "Player" means a customer who consents to the TOS (in the plural, "Players"). Players less than twenty (20) years of age shall be deemed to have obtained the consent of their parents or other persons who have parental authority when consenting to the TOS.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600003:
Article 3. Principle of Self-responsibility
1. Players shall use the Services at their own responsibility, and if any Player causes any loss or damage to another or the Company when using the Services, the Player shall pay damages therefor at his/her own expense and responsibility.
2. Players shall, when giving and receiving any information or service to and from any third party other than the Company through the Services, be fully liable for any acts and contents incidental thereto. If any Player causes any loss or damage to another or to the Company when giving and receiving any such information or service, the Player shall pay damages therefor at his/her own expense and responsibility.
3. Players shall, if any problem arises through the Services with any third party other than the Company, deal with and resolve the problem at their own expense and responsibility. The Company shall not be obligated or liable in any way whatsoever for arbitration, dealing, compensation, damages or any other matters with respect to such problem.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600004:
Article 4. Liability for Fees and Charges
1. The Services are free of charge; however, Players shall prepare the necessary hardware, lines and any other items for their use of the Services at their own expense and responsibility.
2. Fees for the Software and contents and services provided accompanying the Services will be determined by the Company at its discretion depending on the details and time of such provision.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600005:
Article 5. Management of Personal Information
1. For the protection of personal information, Players shall not include information that leads to his/her identification in any information posted or disclosed by him/her through the Services when using the Services.
2. The Company shall not protect information posted on or disclosed in the Services.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600006:
Article 6. Ownership of Rights
1. Any rights in and to the Software and the Services, including intellectual property rights (any and all rights including, but not limited to patent rights, utility model rights, trademark rights, design rights, knowhow, trade secrets and copyrights) shall belong to the Company or the third parties in question.
2. Players shall not be entitled to alter, adapt, copy, edit, reproduce, distribute, transmit or publish all pieces of information included in the Software and the Services (any and all kinds of information including, but not limited to images, pictures, characters, scenarios, plots, programs, software and ideas) without the prior approval of the Company.
3. When using the Services, Players shall not have any intellectual property right or claim with respect to data stored on any storage device such as a server for the Services (hereinafter referred to as "Recorded Data"), and Players hereby grant the Company or the third party designated by the Company the right to copy, edit and distribute Recorded Data.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600007:
Article 7. Outsourcing of Operation of the Services
The Company shall be entitled to assign to another all or any part of its rights and obligations related to the operation of the Services or outsource to another the operation of all or any part of the Services.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600009:
Article 9 Discontinuation of Provision of the Services
The Company shall, at any time upon giving prior notice of termination to Players, be entitled to discontinue the provision of all or any part of the Services. In this case, the Company shall notify Players of that fact by posting the same on the Website, by e-mail or through other means the Company thinks reasonable. The notice of termination shall be deemed to have reached all Players upon expiration of thirty (30) days after the Company has started posting such notice on the Website.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600010:
Article 10 Prohibited Matters
1. No Player shall be entitled to assign to, transfer to, sell to or buy from another, change the name to another's name of, or provide another as pledge or other security with, any of his/her rights held as a Player, and items, characters and saved data within the game related to the Software which are obtained in the Services (including so-called "real money trading").
2. No Player shall perform any of the following other acts on the Services:
(1) Playing a game in a manner offensive to other Players;
(2) Playing a game using falsified data regardless of the circumstances;
(3) Playing a game in a manner not intended by the Company using any function or failure of the Software or the Services; or
(4) Performing any other act determined to be inappropriate by the Company or a third party providing any of the systems used for the Services.
3. With respect to Players who have performed acts prohibited under this Article, the Company or the third party providing any of the systems used for the Services shall be entitled at its discretion to give such Players warnings, delete the Recorded Data of such Players, or have such Players suspend or cease their use of the Services.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600011:
Article 11 Third-Party Software: Easy Anti-Cheat
The company shall employ the use of the â€œEasy Anti-Cheatâ€ anti-cheat service (hereinafter referred to as "EACâ€) for the sake of preventing acts detailed to in Article 10, Section 2., Subsections (2), (3) and (4). EAC is operated by a third-party service provider. EAC has a client software that is integrated into the Software. When starting the Software, the EAC client software will automatically load and install its latest version to the Hardware. EAC will monitor the Hardware, analyze the Software binaries and scan Hardware memory for the purpose of detecting and preventing cheating in the Software (hereinafter referred to as the â€œPurposeâ€). For the Purpose, EAC stores information regarding cheating methods used in the Software (hereinafter referred to as â€œCheat Dataâ€). By agreeing to this Agreement, or otherwise using the Software or the Services, the Player gives their consent that EAC may gather, store, share, and publish Cheat Data for the Purpose. The Cheat Data will be used solely for the Purpose. This includes but is not limited to identifying and banning Players who are cheating in the Software or the Services, analyzing cheating behavior and cheating codes, as well as sharing data about cheats with affiliates of EAC.
You can find more information about the privacy practices of EAC by viewing the privacy statement of EAC service provider EPIC GAMES (https://www.epicgames.com/site/ja/privacypolicy). If the Player denies EAC the ability to process personal data in accordance with their privacy statement or requests EAC to remove or delete personal data, the Company has the right to block the Playerâ€™s access to the Software or the Services and prevent use of the Software or the Services.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600012:
Article 12 Damages
1. Excluding cases of bad faith or gross negligence, the Company shall not be liable in any way to Players for any loss or damage caused to Players and third parties due to the Players' use of the Services, nor shall the Company be obligated to pay damages therefor.
2. With respect to the deletion of the Recorded Data of Players, the cessation or cancellation of Players' registration, or the cessation, suspension or discontinuation of Players' use of the Services by the Company, the Company shall not be obligated to pay any damages, unless the Company acts in bad faith or gross negligence.
3. Even if the Company is liable for damages for any reason, the Company shall not be liable to pay damages of an amount exceeding those for the loss or damage directly caused to Players, nor shall the Company be liable to pay damages for any incidental, indirect, special or future damage, or lost profits.
4. If any Player causes any loss or damage to other Players or third parties due to his/her use of the Services, the Player shall resolve such issue at his/her own expense and responsibility, and not cause any loss or damage to the Company.
5. If any Player causes any loss or damage to the Company due to his/her act in violation of the TOS or his/her improper or illegal actions, the Company shall be entitled to make a claim for damages against the Player.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600013:
Article 13 Disclaimers
1. Each Player shall, if another makes any inquiry or complaint to him/her in connection with his/her use of the Services, or he/she has any request, question or complaint about another's act, deal with and resolve such issue at his/her own expense and responsibility, and the Company shall not be liable or obligated in any way therefor.
2. Players shall note that they will avoid using the Services at their discretion in an excessive manner that may disturb their sound lifestyle. The Company shall not be liable in any way for any social, mental or physical damage caused to any Player due to the Player's deviant behavior therefrom.
3. For conflicts of interests or problems between Players arising in connection with the Players' use of the Services, or for measures taken thereunder by the Company or third parties, the Company shall not be liable in any way whatsoever.
4. Since there is a possibility for the Services to be unavailable depending on the individual environment of each Player due to the nature of the Services, the Company shall not warrant that the Services will be available in any environment.
5. The Company shall not warrant in any way that the Services are free of errors or viruses, or otherwise games will progress in a safe manner.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600014:
Article 14 Governing Law and Dispute Resolution
The TOS shall, including the execution, validity, interpretation and performance hereof, be governed by the laws and regulations of Japan by all means. If any problem, dispute, difficulty or other issue arises in connection with the Services between any Player and the Company, the Player and the Company shall resolve the issue through consultation in good faith, and in the event of a failure in resolving it through consultation, it shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the Tokyo District Court in the first instance as agreed upon between the parties.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.600015:
Supplementary Provisions
The TOS shall come into effect upon sale of the Software.
The TOS may be modified from time to time.
The latest information shall be posted on the Website and made referenceable by Players from time to time.

N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.57: Fast Travel to Sites of Grace

N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.1:
Crouch to make it harder for enemies to discover you.
Especially effective in tall grass.
Attacking an enemy that hasn't noticed you will cause more damage than usual.

<?keyicon@9?>: <?keyActName@9?>
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.2:
Use an armament in your left hand or both hands to guard against incoming attacks.
Shields are particularly effective for guarding.
Guarding consumes stamina.
If your stamina runs out, your stance will be broken.

<?keyicon@24?>: Guard
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.3:
You can perform a counterattack immediately after blocking an enemy attack.
Guard counters make it easy to break an enemy's stance.

<?keyicon@23?> immediately after blocking an attack: Guard Counter
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.4:
Wielding an armament in two hands will increase your effective strength for that armament by 50%.
This eases attribute requirements, and armaments that scale with strength will do more damage. In addition, attacks with that armament are more difficult to repel with shields.

<?keyicon@27?>+<?keyicon@24?>/<?keyicon@22?>: Wield with two hands
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.5:
Charge attacks and jump attacks are powerful.
Using them makes it easy to break an enemy's stance.
They are also likely to knock mounted enemies off of their mounts.

Hold <?keyicon@23?>: Charge attack
<?keyicon@23?> while jumping: Jump attack
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.6:
Armaments have special abilities called skills.
Skills are highly varied, and range from powerful attacks to temporary effects.
Using skills consumes FP.

<?keyicon@25?>: <?keyActName@25?>
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.7:
Shields allow you to use the "Parry" skill to deflect enemies' close-range attacks.
A successful parry will break the attacker's stance, giving you a chance to perform a critical hit.

<?keyicon@25?> in time with an enemy attack: Parry
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.8:
Lock-on to an enemy to keep it targeted, making it easier to focus on it as you fight.

<?keyicon@15?>: <?keyActName@15?>
<?keyControlCamera?> while locked-on to a target: Change target
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.9:
When wielding a bow with two hands, you can hold <?keyicon@24?> for precision aiming.
This lets you aim more precisely with <?keyControlCamera?>.
You can do major damage to foes of human or similar build by aiming for their heads.

<?keyicon@24?> while wielding a bow with two hands: Precision aiming
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.10:
You can equip up to three armaments each to your left and right hands.

Some armaments, such as shields, have different actions depending on which hand equips them.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.11:
You can equip up to ten items at a time.
Equipped items can be used without accessing the item menu.
You can also assign items to your pouch to use them directly from the main menu.

<?keyicon@18?>: <?keyActName@18?>
<?keyicon@26?>: <?keyActName@26?>
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.12:
Raise your torch to see further into dark spaces.

<?keyicon@24?> with torch equipped in left hand: Raise torch
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.13:
If you get behind an enemy, you'll have a chance to perform a critical hit.
You can also perform a critical hit after breaking an enemy's stance.
Stance-break critical hits cause more damage than critical hits from behind.

<?keyicon@22?> when near a backturned enemy: Critical hit
<?keyicon@22?> when near a stance-broken enemy: Critical hit
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.14: Use "Gestures" from the main menu to perform a variety of basic poses.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.15:
Use your map to check your current position, as well as the terrain and surrounding structures.
You can update your map with new information by finding map fragments at steles along the road.

<?keyicon@29?>: <?keyActName@29?>
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.16:
Jump while on horseback near a spiritspring to ride its current high into the air.
You won't take damage from jumping into a spiritspring while on horseback, even from a great height.

<?keyicon@8?> at a spiritspring while on horseback: Spiritspring jump
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.17:
When you have multiple items equipped, you can hold <?keyicon@18?> to quickly select the item in your first item slot.

Hold <?keyicon@18?>: Select first equipped item
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.50:
Upon dying, you will drop any runes in your possession at the site of your death.
You can reclaim those runes by reaching that same spot again.
However, if you die again before reclaiming those dropped runes, they will be lost forever.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.52:
When the monument icon is shown on the left side of the screen, you can summon spirits from ashes.
There are several different types of spirits that can be summoned.
Summoning spirits typically consumes FP.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.53:
Resting at a site of grace will restore your HP, FP, and cleanse any status ailments.
It will also refill your sacred flasks.

However, most of the enemies you've defeated will be revived.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.54:
Sites of grace that you haven't discovered yet illuminate their surroundings.
If you see light while exploring, seek it outâ€”you might find a site of grace.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.55:
Grace exists to guide the Tarnished and lead them along the proper path.
Even now, some sites of grace retain that power.
Their golden rays will guide you along your way.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.56:
The Flask of Crimson Tears replenishes your HP.
The Flask of Cerulean Tears replenishes your FP.

At sites of grace, you can allocate portions of doses to each flask.
You can also use certain items to upgrade your flasks at sites of grace.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.57:
Through your map, you can instantly travel to any sites of grace that you've discovered.
However, there are some dungeons and other areas where this cannot be done.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.58:
While on horseback, you can attack with armaments equipped in your right hand or in both hands.
If you take a certain amount of damage while on horseback, you will fall from your horse.
This will leave you greatly vulnerable.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.59:
You cannot enter large buildings, caves, catacombs, or similar spaces while on horseback.
You also cannot summon your horse while inside such spaces.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.60:
If you have a Crafting Kit, you can make various items from materials that you find.
Select "Item Crafting" from the main menu to make items.

<?keyicon@28?>: <?keyActName@28?>
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.61:
You will need cracked pots or other containers to craft certain items.
Container items will run out with use, but the containers themselves will remain.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.62:
Ashes of War are memories of the affinities and skills imbued in armaments wielded long ago.
With a Whetstone Knife, you can use Ashes of War to customize your armaments at sites of grace.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.64:
Upon dying, you will be revived at the last site of grace that you visited.

However, if there is a Stake of Marika near where you died, you can choose to be revived there instead.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.65:
When you carry more than 70% of your maximum equipment load, your dodge rolling will become slower and clumsier.
If you exceed your maximum equipment load entirely, you will be unable to roll at all.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.66: While in combat, you are unable to craft items or open your map.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.67:
Spirits that you've summoned from ashes can be made more powerful by a spirit tuner.
You'll need glovewort to upgrade spirits.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.68:
When you level up, you can spend runes to increase your attributes.
As your attributes increase, your level risesâ€”and so does the amount of runes required for your next attribute increase.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.70:
When the poison gauge is full, you will become poisoned and take continuous damage.
The higher your immunity, the longer it takes for the poison gauge to fill.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.71:
When the scarlet rot gauge is full, you will become sick and take continuous damage.
The scarlet rot is a very dangerous status ailment, but the higher your immunity, the longer it takes for the gauge to fill.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.72:
When the blood loss gauge is full, you will hemorrhage blood.
This causes a large amount of damage relative to your maximum HP.
The higher your robustness, the longer it takes for the blood loss gauge to fill.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.73:
When the frost gauge is full, you will take damage and become frostbitten for a while.
While suffering from frostbite, you will take increased damage from other sources.
The higher your robustness, the longer it takes for the frost gauge to fill.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.74:
When the sleep gauge is full, you will become drowsy.
Weaker characters will fall asleep entirely.
The higher your focus, the longer it takes for the sleep gauge to fill.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.75:
When the madness gauge is full, you will go mad and lose a great deal of both HP and FP.
Only humans can be afflicted with madness.
The higher your focus, the longer it takes for the madness gauge to fill.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.76:
When your death gauge is full, you will be struck with instant death.
This is a very dangerous status ailment, but the higher your resistance to death, the longer it takes for the death gauge to fill.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.77:
Heavy armor provides high poise, making you less likely to recoil from enemy attacks.
Wielding a heavy weapon with two hands may also provide similar effects.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.100:
During cooperative multiplayer, a Furled Finger's objective is to help the Host of Fingers defeat the boss of the area.
A Furled Finger will return to their own world when they die or the boss is defeated, whichever happens first.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.101:
During competitive multiplayer, a duelist's objective is to defeat the Host of Fingers.
A duelist will return to their own world when they die or the Host of Fingers is defeated, whichever happens first.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.102:
In typical multiplayer, there can be up to two cooperators and one invader or adversary present at once.

The host player can use a Taunter's Tongue to increase the maximum number of invaders or adversaries.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.103:
With a Furlcalling Finger Remedy, you can see summon signs left by players in other worlds.

If you summon another player through their sign, multiplayer will begin, with you as the Host of Fingers.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.104:
With a Tarnished's Furled Finger, you can leave a gold summon sign.
This sign will appear in other players' worlds and allow them to summon you as a Furled Finger for cooperative multiplayer.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.105:
With a Duelist's Furled Finger, you can leave a red summon sign.
This sign will appear in other players' worlds and allow them to summon you as a duelist adversary for competitive multiplayer.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.106:
With a Festering Bloody Finger, you can enter another player's world as an invading Bloody Finger.
There are other items that allow you to invade other worlds as well.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.107:
If you use a White Cipher Ring, you will automatically request for a hunter from another world to come to your rescue when your world is invaded.
(Summoning is not always possible.)
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.108: If you use a Blue Cipher Ring, you will make yourself open to summons for rescue from other worlds. You will be summoned to their world as a hunter.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.109:
In each area, you may find effigies of martyrs.
These effigies are summoning pools.

Summon signs made with small effigies are gathered at these summoning pools.
You'll find it easy to summon other players at these locations.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.110: If you set a group password, you'll be more likely to see messages, summon signs, bloodstains, and phantoms from other players using the same password.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.111:
If you set a multiplayer password, you'll only be matched with other players using the same password for most multiplayer features.

However, multiplayer passwords do not apply to invasion multiplayer.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.112:
You can use the Messages menu to leave messages for other players.

Your message will appear in other players' worlds at the spot where you stood when you wrote it.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.113:
During multiplayer, you can only explore a limited area.
Areas beyond those limits are blocked off with a wall of light.
They will be accessible again after multiplayer ends.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.114:
You may occasionally see faint, white phantoms.
These are traces of players in other worlds and the actions they recently performed.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.115:
Bloodstains are left behind in spots where players in other worlds have died.
You can examine them to see how those players died.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.116:
During supportive multiplayer, a hunter's objective is to defeat an invader.
A hunter will return to their own world when they die or the invader is defeated, whichever happens first.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.117:
There are two types of summon signs left by players in other worlds.

Gold signs will summon Furled Finger cooperators.
Red signs will summon duelist adversaries.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.118:
You can change the message format to leave more complex messages.
You can also attach gestures to your messages.

<?keyicon@30?>: Change message format
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.119:
During invasion multiplayer, the invader's objective is to defeat the Host of Fingers.
An invader will return to their own world when they die or the Host of Fingers is defeated, whichever happens first.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.150:
Attacks with certain affinities, such as fire or lightning, may make guarding less effective than it is against normal physical attacks.

Guarding does not work against many grappling attacks.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.151:
Some attacks may break an enemy's stance, giving you a chance to perform a critical hit.
Charge attacks and jump attacks make it particularly easy to break an enemy's stance.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.152:
Repeatedly attack a mounted enemy to knock them off of their mount and break their stance.
This will give you a chance to perform a critical hit.
Charge attacks and jump attacks are particularly likely to knock enemies off of their mounts.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.153: The slashing attacks of sharp weapons are largely ineffective against hardened armor and scales. Strike attacks are likely to hit the mark.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.200:
There are both Crimson and Cerulean Teardrop Scarabs.
Defeat them to replenish the flasks that match their type.
However, you cannot replenish more flasks than your maximum amount allows.

N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302440: Fast Travel to Sites of Grace

N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.101110: <?keyControlCamera?> while locked-on to a target: Change target
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.101130: Materials can be used to craft items.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.101150: <?keyicon@22?> near a backturned enemy: Critical hit
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.201100:
Each hand can be equipped with up to three armaments, allowing you to toggle between them.

Armaments can also be two-handed, making attacks more difficult to repel with shields and boosting effective strength by 50%.

<?keyicon@19?>: <?keyActName@19?>
<?keyicon@20?>: <?keyActName@20?>
<?keyicon@27?>+<?keyicon@24?>/<?keyicon@22?>: Wield with two hands
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301020:
Resting at a site of grace will restore your HP, FP, and cleanse any status ailments.
It will also refill your sacred flasks.
However, most of the enemies you've defeated will be revived.

You can find sites of grace by going where light converges.

*These explanations are acquired in the form of info items and can be accessed from the inventory at any time.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301060:
You can memorize sorceries and incantations at sites of grace.

You must have a staff equipped to cast sorceries, or a sacred seal equipped to cast incantations.
Casting sorceries and incantations consumes FP.

<?keyicon@0017?>: <?keyActName@17?>
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301130:
Equip a bow to fire arrows.
You can equip up to two types of arrows to choose from at once.

When wielding a bow with two hands, hold <?keyicon@24?> for precision aiming.
Use <?keyControlCamera?> to adjust your aim.

<?keyicon@22?>: Fire arrow type 1
<?keyicon@23?>: Fire arrow type 2
<?keyicon@24?>: Precision aiming
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301140:
Crouch to make it harder for enemies to discover you.
Especially effective in tall grass.

Attacking an enemy that hasn't noticed you will cause more damage than usual.

<?keyicon@9?>: <?keyActName@9?>
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301160:
Some attacks may break an enemy's stance, giving you a chance to perform a critical hit.

Charge attacks and jump attacks make it particularly easy to break an enemy's stance.

Hold <?keyicon@23?>: Charge attack
<?keyicon@23?> while jumping: Jump attack
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301500:
Use your map to check your current position, as well as the terrain and surrounding structures.

You can update your map with new information by finding map fragments at steles along the road.

You can also use the map to freely place beacons of light to serve as landmarks as you explore.

<?keyicon@29?>: <?keyActName@29?>
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301510:
Grace exists to guide the Tarnished and lead them along the proper path.

Even now, some sites of grace retain that power. Their golden rays will guide you along your way.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301520:
Use the Spectral Steed Whistle to summon and ride your spectral steed.

If your spectral steed dies, you can summon it again, but it will cost one Flask of Crimson Tears to do so.

You can dismount by using the whistle again or by pressing <?keyicon@0009?>.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301530:
Upon dying, you will be revived at the last site of grace that you visited.

You will drop any runes in your possession at the site of your death.
If you die again before reclaiming those runes, they will be lost forever.

The compass at the top of the screen indicates the direction of the lost runes.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301540:
Upon dying, you will be revived at the last site of grace that you visited.

However, if there is a Stake of Marika near where you died, you can choose to be revived there instead.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301550:
With a Spirit Calling Bell, you can use ashes to summon various spirits.
Summoning typically consumes FP.

You can only summon one type of spirit at a time.
You cannot summon spirits during multiplayer.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301560:
In every corner of the Lands Between, you will find fruits and flowers, mushrooms and butterflies, and various other useful materials.

These materials can be used for item crafting.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301570:
If you have a Crafting Kit, you can make various items from materials that you find.

Select "Item Crafting" from the main menu to make items.

You can learn to craft more items by finding cookbooks.

<?keyicon@28?>: <?keyActName@28?>
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301580:
You will need cracked pots or other containers to craft certain items.
You will not be able to make more of those items than you have containers.

Container items will run out with use, but the containers themselves will remain.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301590:
You can find crystal tears at the bases of Minor Erdtrees and elsewhere throughout the Lands Between.

At sites of grace, you can mix two crystal tears in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.
This will allow you to create elixirs with various custom effects.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301600:
With a Whetstone Knife, you can use ashes of war to grant your armaments new skills at sites of grace.

An armament can only have one skill.
Any skill it previously had will be removed.

An armament's type determines what skills it can have. Some special armaments have unique skills and cannot be granted new ones.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301610:
You can use the Birdseye Telescopes found in various areas to get a bird's-eye view of the terrain in the direction that the telescope is facing.

<?keyicon@17?>: Zoom in
<?keyicon@18?>: Zoom out
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301620:
Jump while on horseback near a spiritspring to ride its current high into the air.

You won't take damage from jumping into a spiritspring while on horseback, even from a great height.

<?keyicon@8?> at a spiritspring while on horseback: Spiritspring jump
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301630:
Vanquishing an enemy group will replenish your flasks.

The number and type of flasks to be replenished varies, depending on the enemy group.

You cannot replenish more flasks than your maximum amount allows.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301640:
There are both Crimson and Cerulean Teardrop Scarabs.
Defeat them to replenish the flasks that match their type.

However, you cannot replenish more flasks than your maximum amount allows.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301650:
Use Furlcalling Finger Remedy to reveal summon signs of players from other worlds.

Gold signs indicate an ally.
Red signs indicate an adversary.
The multiplayer session will begin once either type has been summoned.
(You will take the role of the Host of Fingers.)
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301660:
Use Tarnished's Furled Finger to write a gold summon sign.

Cooperative multiplayer will begin once you have been summoned by a player from another world.

You will take the role of an ally (Furled Finger) and your objective is to defeat the area boss.

The compass at the top of the screen indicates the direction of the summoner (Host of Fingers).
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301670:
Use Duelist's Furled Finger to write a red summon sign.

Competitive multiplayer will begin once you have been summoned by a player from another world.

You will take the role of an adversary (Duelist) and your objective is to defeat the Host of Fingers who summoned you.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301680:
Use Festering Bloody Finger to attempt to invade the world of another player.

The multiplayer session will begin once the invasion succeeds.

You will take the role of an invader (Bloody Finger) and your objective is to defeat the Host of Fingers of that world.

If you stray far from the Host of Fingers, the compass at the top of the screen points to their location.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.301690:
In each area, you may find effigies of martyrs.
These effigies are summoning pools.

You'll find it easy to summon other players at these locations, as co-op and hostile summoning signs created with small effigies gather at summoning pools.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302000:
With a Whetstone Knife, you can use ashes of war to grant affinities to your armaments at sites of grace.

This way, you can alter an armament's attack affinity, boost attribute scaling, and more.

An armament's type determines what affinities it can have. Some special armaments, like those with unique skills, cannot be granted new affinities.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302380:
If you use a Blue Cipher Ring, you will make yourself open to summons for rescue from other worlds.

The multiplayer session will begin once you have been summoned as a hunter, and your objective is to defeat the invader of that world.

The compass at the top of the screen indicates the direction of the summoner (Host of Fingers).
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302390:
You must be near a rebirth monument to summon spirits from ashes.

When you are close to a rebirth monument and able to summon, a monument icon will appear on the left side of the screen.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302400:
You can perform a counterattack immediately after blocking an enemy attack.

Guard counters make it easy to break an enemy's stance.

<?keyicon@23?> immediately after blocking an attack: Guard Counter
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302410:
Use an armament in your left hand or both hands to guard against incoming attacks.
Guarding is especially effective when done with a shield.

Guarding consumes stamina.
If your stamina runs out, your stance will be broken.

<?keyicon@24?>: Guard
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302420:
If you use a White Cipher Ring, you will automatically request for a hunter from another world to come to your rescue when your world is invaded.
(Can also be used after you are invaded.)

The hunter will be summoned once the request succeeds, and their objective is to defeat the invader of your world.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302430:
Armaments have special abilities called skills.

Skills are highly varied, and range from powerful attacks to temporary effects.
Using skills consumes FP.

<?keyicon@25?>: <?keyActName@25?>
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302440:
Through your map, you can instantly travel to any sites of grace that you've discovered.

However, there are some dungeons and other areas where this cannot be done.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302450:
At a smithing table, you can spend runes and smithing stones to strengthen your armaments.

Somewhere in the Lands Between, you may meet a blacksmith who can make your armaments even stronger.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302460:
The Roundtable Hold is a place where Tarnished gather, guided by grace. Combat is prohibited on the premises due to a pact of non-aggression. (This rule is in effect when the Roundtable icon is displayed.)
The Roundtable Hold is located outside of this world. It can only be reached through sites of grace. (Can also be accessed by using the map to travel.)

<?keyicon@29?>: <?keyActName@29?>
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302470:
Monk Jiko seeks the deep fog of sleep.

Find someone in a deep sleep, and capture their Dream Mist by using St. Trina's Crystal Ball.

Those in a deep sleep can be identified by the mist surrounding them.

<?keyicon@27?> when near someone in a deep sleep: Capture Dream Mist
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302480:
From "Pouch" in the main menu, you can equip six items to your pouches.

Four of those items can be used without opening the main menu.

<?keyicon@27?>+<?keyicon@17?>: Use item in Pouch 1
<?keyicon@27?>+<?keyicon@19?>: Use item in Pouch 2
<?keyicon@27?>+<?keyicon@20?>: Use item in Pouch 3
<?keyicon@27?>+<?keyicon@18?>: Use item in Pouch 4
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302490:
You can avoid enemy attacks with a dodge roll or backstep.
Both of these actions consume stamina.

<?keyMove?>+<?keyicon@7?>: Dodge roll
<?keyicon@7?>: Backstep
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.302500:
The Great Runes you receive by defeating shardbearers have lost their beneficial power.
However, their power can be restored at Divine Towers throughout the Lands Between.

See the description of each Great Rune to discover which Divine Tower you should visit.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.309000:
You will need certain items to participate in each type of multiplayer:
cooperative, invasion, or competitive.

Select "Multiplayer" from the main menu to see your multiplayer items.
You can also use them directly from this menu.

<?keyicon@28?>: <?keyActName@28?>
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402000:
With the Equipment menu, you can equip armaments, arrows, bolts, armor, talismans, and items.

You can equip up to three armaments each to your left and right hands.
The actions each armament performs will vary based on which hand is wielding it.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402010:
With the Item Crafting menu, you can make various items from materials that you find.

You can learn to craft more items by finding cookbooks.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402020:
With the Inventory menu, you can browse the items you're carrying, drop them on the ground, or throw them away.

You can also use tools from the Inventory menu.

<?keyicon@31?>: Show large image and explanation.
<?keyicon@30?>: Toggle character data
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402030:
With the Status menu, you can check your level, attributes, base stats, and more.

The information shown here also reflects changes to your attack, defense, and resistances bestowed by armaments and armor that you have equipped.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402040:
With the Messages menu, you can write messages that players in other worlds can read at the spot where you left them.

You can change the message format to leave more complex messages and also attach gestures to your messages.

You can rate other players' messages.
Whenever another player rates a message that you've written, your HP will be replenished.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402050:
With the Multiplayer menu, you can use various multiplayer items.

If you set a group password, you'll be more likely to see messages, summon signs, bloodstains, phantoms, and so on from others using the same password.

If you set a multiplayer password, you'll only be matched with other players using the same password for most multiplayer features.
However, multiplayer passwords do not apply to invasion multiplayer.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402100:
With the Map menu, you can check your current position and terrain and buildings in the surrounding area.

You can also freely place beacons of light to serve as landmarks as you explore.

Lastly, through your map, you can select any site of grace that you've discovered and travel there instantaneously.
However, there are some dungeons and other areas where this cannot be done.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402200:
With the Level Up menu, you can spend runes to increase your attributes.

With each attribute increase, your level rises by one.
As your level rises, so does the amount of runes required for your next attribute increase.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402210:
You can increase the number of flasks available.

Locate Flask Shards in order to increase the number of flasks.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402220:
You can increase the healing amount of each flask.

Locate "Immortal Ashes" in order to increase the healing amount.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402230:
With this menu, you can allocate the number of uses in each of your flasks.

You have a set total of maximum flask uses.
You can decide how many of those uses are for the HP-replenishing Flask of Crimson Tears, and how many are for the FP-replenishing Flask of Cerulean Tears.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402240:
With the Memorize Spells menu, you can memorize sorceries and incantations.

You must have a staff equipped to cast sorceries, or a sacred seal equipped to cast incantations.
Casting sorceries and incantations consumes FP.

Your memory slots determine the number of sorceries and incantations you can memorize.
You can increase your memory slots by obtaining a Memory Stone.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402250:
With this menu, you can place items that you're carrying into the chest for storage, or take stored items out of the chest.

If you are already carrying the maximum number of items when you pick up a new item, it will be stored in the chest automatically.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402300:
With the shop menu, you can spend runes to purchase various items.

You can also sell items for runes.

Each merchant stocks a different variety of items for purchase.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402310:
Weapons and shields can be upgraded by using upgrade materials.

Higher ranked upgrade materials are required for highler level weapons.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402320:
With the Ashes of War menu, you can use Ashes of War to grant skills and affinities to your armaments at sites of grace.

An armament can only have one skill.
Any skill it previously had will be lost.

By adding an affinity, you can alter an armament's attack affinity, boost attribute scaling, and more.

An armament's type determines what skills and affinities it can have. Some special armaments cannot be granted new skills or affinities using Ashes of War.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402330:
With the Spirit Tuning menu, you can spend runes and Grave Gloveworts to strengthen the spirits you summon from ashes.

To strengthen named spirits, you'll need Ghost Gloveworts.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402340:
You can learn magic from the Dragon Communion.

Memorize these spells by offering Dragon Communion Seeds.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402350:
With the Great Rune menu, you can equip Great Runes that
have had their power restored.

You can use a Rune Arc to give even greater benefits to
your equipped Great Runes.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402360:
With this menu, you can mix two crystal tears in the Flask of Wondrous Physick.

This will allow you to create physicks with various custom effects.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402370:
With the Rebirth menu, you can spend Larval Tears to clear
your levels and reassign them from square one.

You must reassign all levels until you reach your present
level and you cannot make any attributes lower than
their initial level determined by your origin.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402380:
With the Power of Remembrance menu, you can draw out the power of a remembrance's namesake.

Each remembrance can provide one power. Once that power is claimed, the remembrance will be lost.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402390:
With the smithing menu, you can spend runes and smithing stones to strengthen your armaments.

You can strengthen your armaments up to +3 at a smithing table.

Somewhere in the Lands Between, you may meet a blacksmith who can make your armaments even stronger.
N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.402400:
With the Remembrance Duplication menu, you can duplicate remembrances you've previously acquired.
(This includes remembrances from which you've already drawn out power.)

Duplication can only be performed once per mausoleum.

N:\\GR\\data\\INTERROOT_win64\\msg\\engU.606301:
